title: No inline password length validation on sign-up — short passwords silently sent to Supabase
reported_by: qa-014 — test [2] password too short (< 6 chars) → inline error shown, signUp NOT called
root_cause: handleSignUp() in AuthScreen.tsx calls signUp() without checking password.length first. Supabase enforces a 6-character minimum and returns an error, but the user sees a raw API error rather than a friendly inline message.
implementation_plan: 1. In AuthScreen.tsx handleSignUp(), before calling signUp(), add: if (password.length < 6) { setError(t('passwordMinLength')); return; }
2. Add i18n key 'passwordMinLength' to en/auth.json: 'Password must be at least 6 characters'
3. Add matching Hebrew translation to he/auth.json
4. Optionally: show a real-time character count hint below the password field (not required for passing test)
5. Run npm test — test [2] should now pass
acceptance_criteria: Submitting sign-up with a password < 6 characters does NOT call signUp()
An inline error matching /password.*too short|at least 6|minimum.*characters/i is shown
fix_complexity: trivial — 3 lines of code + 2 i18n keys
